result.execSummary:
The defendant Antoinette M. Gaddo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Impose/Stay a 150 day jail sentence - huber if revoked (75 in jail/75 on electronic monitoring if approved by jail personnel and risk assessment).
3 days pre-trial incarceration credit if probation revoked.

miscConds.notes: Pay fine, costs, and DNA surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Defendant not to be on the premises of Walmart in Plover while on probation.
If recommended by the Agent and found to be appropriate defendant can be eligible for early discharge from probation.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations - sign release if assessment has been completed for agent to verify.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Same as count 1.
Concurrent with: with Count 1.

records.addlTxt: Order on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation /s/ TTF 01/20/17
Letter from DOC dated 12/12/16 in re: Probation Early Discharge Recommendations

Defendant Antoinette M. Gaddo in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:00 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Victim notification had been given.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to her sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay a 150 day jail sentence - huber if revoked (75 in jail/75 on electronic monitoring if approved by jail personnel and risk assessment)
3 days pre-trial incarceration credit if probation revoked
Placed on Probation for 24 months
Pay fine of $200 + costs (includes DNA Surcharge)
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations - sign release if assessment has been completed for agent to verify.
Obtain and Maintain full-time employment.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Defendant not to be on the premises of Walmart in Plover while on probation.
If recommended by the Agent and found to be appropriate defendant can be eligible for early discharge from probation.

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay a 150 day jail sentence to run concurrent to Count 1 
Placed on Probation for 24 months
Pay Court costs 
Comply with conditions in Count 1
